item.title: Mortgage Broker vs Bank: Which is Better for New Hampshire Borrowers?
item.description:
New Hampshire borrowers choosing between mortgage brokers and retail banks face a fundamental trade-off: multi-lender access and wholesale pricing versus single-lender convenience and brand familiarity.

How Mortgage Brokers Work

Brokers are intermediaries between borrowers and wholesale lenders:

  1. You apply once with the broker
  2. Broker shops 5–20 lenders for best rate/terms
  3. Broker recommends lender based on pricing and approval odds
  4. Wholesale lender underwrites and funds the loan
  5. Broker earns origination fee (1%–2%) or yield spread premium

Brokers don’t lend their own money—they access wholesale lending networks unavailable to consumers directly.

item.title: How NH Mortgage Brokers Access Wholesale Pricing That Beats Retail Banks
item.description:
New Hampshire mortgage brokers access wholesale lending channels that price 0.125%–0.375% below retail bank rates on identical loans—creating a structural rate advantage even after broker compensation.

What is Wholesale Mortgage Lending?

Wholesale lenders fund loans but don’t work directly with consumers:

  • United Wholesale Mortgage (UWM): Largest wholesale lender, broker-only channel
  • Caliber Home Loans: Wholesale and retail, but wholesale pricing is tighter
  • Flagstar Bank: Major wholesale aggregator for conventional/FHA
  • PennyMac: Government loan specialist with wholesale broker channel
  • Angel Oak: Non-QM and portfolio wholesale lender

These lenders only accept applications through licensed mortgage brokers—you cannot apply directly.

item.title: How to Choose the Right Mortgage Broker in New Hampshire
item.description:
Choosing a New Hampshire mortgage broker requires evaluating lender access, fee transparency, experience, and licensing—not just accepting the first broker referral from your realtor.

What Makes a Good NH Mortgage Broker

Quality brokers provide:

  1. Wide lender access (15+ wholesale lenders across conventional, FHA, VA, jumbo, non-QM)
  2. Transparent fee disclosure (clear origination charges in Loan Estimate)
  3. Relevant experience (knows NH market nuances: seasonal homes, septic systems, investment properties)
  4. NMLS licensing (active NH license, no regulatory actions)
  5. Responsive communication (returns calls within 24 hours, explains options clearly)
